meanings.definition: To cut food into thin matchstick-shaped pieces.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys julienning vegetables for stir-fries.
meanings.sent2: The chef is julienning the carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent3: While julienning the potatoes, she accidentally dropped one on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His precise julienning skills turned the ordinary salad into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the knife julienning through the cucumber filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting food into thin matchstick-shaped pieces.
meanings.sent1: Julienning requires a sharp knife and patience.
meanings.sent2: The julienning of the apples adds a nice texture to the dish.
meanings.sent3: During the cooking competition, her julienning technique impressed the judges.
meanings.sent4: The julienning of the radishes symbolized the chef's attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The julienning in the recipe made the dish visually appealing.
